alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 10:33AM MST until March 07 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches below 4000 feet and up to 4 inches above 4000 feet. Periods of more intense snow showers will quickly reduce visibility down to less than one mile. For Lookout Pass: periods of slick conditions expected during the daytime, with more intense snowfall and further accumulations this evening. * WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, and I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
